intro: Allophylus hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy alder, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its fruit is a three-chambered capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. Allophylus hirsutus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
